message.content:
cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.RO, cs.MA, cs.IT 

This paper discusses wireless control systems (WCSs) and proposes a flexible time-triggered sampling scheme using smart sensors. The paper focuses on the control aspect of the system, which suggests that it is likely to belong to the cs.SY (Systems and Control) category. Additionally, the paper deals with network traffic load and bandwidth limitations, which suggests that it could also belong to the cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) category. The use of smart sensors and feedback control technology suggests that the paper could also belong to the cs.RO (Robotics) category. The paper also discusses simulation results, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems) category. Finally, the paper deals with resource efficiency, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.IT (Information Theory) category.
